about_the_game:
Suzhou classical gardens can be traced back to the Spring and Autumn Period, developed in the Jin and Tang Dynasties, prospered in the Song Dynasty, and flourished in the Ming and Qing Dynasties. The formation of this architectural form is a creation of human attachment to nature, pursuit of harmonious coexistence with nature, and beautification and improvement of their living environment in cities with dense population and lack of natural scenery. Enjoy a quiet time by making pottery in the garden.

This DLC includes a crafting scene and a pottery wheel. Once you purchase this pack, you can use them at no extra cost.
Note: At least version 0.9.9f of Master Of Pottery is required to run this DLC.
detailed_description:
Suzhou classical gardens can be traced back to the Spring and Autumn Period, developed in the Jin and Tang Dynasties, prospered in the Song Dynasty, and flourished in the Ming and Qing Dynasties. The formation of this architectural form is a creation of human attachment to nature, pursuit of harmonious coexistence with nature, and beautification and improvement of their living environment in cities with dense population and lack of natural scenery. Enjoy a quiet time by making pottery in the garden.

This DLC includes a crafting scene and a pottery wheel. Once you purchase this pack, you can use them at no extra cost.
Note: At least version 0.9.9f of Master Of Pottery is required to run this DLC.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7 64-bit
  • Processor: Dual core CPU 2.4 GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTS 450-class (Intel HD 4000)
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 600 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS *: Windows 7/8.1/10 64-bit
  • Processor: Quad core CPU 3.0 GHz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 1060 (6 GB)
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
